greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of sets of distinct positive integers with geometric mean n.
comment: a(m) = a(n) if m and n have the same factorization structure.
a(60) is approximately 9.3492e20. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 09 2006
Observe that for any prime p, a(p^k) = A066571(k+1) and the largest set is the powers 0..2k of p.
example: a(2) = 3 as there are three sets viz. {2), {1,4), {1,2,4}, the geometric mean of whose elements is 2.
mathematica: (* Recomputation using existing values and prime signatures *)
